text: in cities along America's west coast
thousands of people have joined the
treasure hunt in trees under bushes
they're looking for hidden cash given
away by an anonymous millionaire for
several days he's been posting clues on
Twitter there are photos and cryptic
messages and each one sparks a race to
locate their cash one man found a roll
of notes attached to a fire hydrant miss
gas money and giving money for the wife
I found it right on this parking meter
takes to it another bundle was left
outside the local courthouse there was
sixty dollars and 20s and then about for
just two dollar bills cash has been
turning up on signposts gates under
leaves and at the seaside it shows a
little chef and a beach but this is a
game where there are no prizes for
coming second did you just find the cash
yeah you guys just beat me buried right
under right in there and this guy just
sort of like popped out there it was the
secret millionaire hasn't yet revealed
his identity he says he's a property
developer who just wants to give some of
his fortune away I'm in that one percent
that some people loathe rather than
hating the people that are successful my
point would be to encourage people who
have been successful to give back a
little bit more this Californian Robin
Hood promises more money drops and more
winners in the coming days nearly a
quarter of a million people are now
following him online waiting for his
next clue Ben gagan BBC News
